title: Holy wrath
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

|   |                                                                                                                                    |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | It has been blessed by The Shining One, dealing an additional three-quarters of any damage that pierces undead and demons' armour. |

The **holy wrath** [brand](/Brand "Brand") does the following:

- Against [undead](/Undead "Undead") and [demons](/Demon "Demon"), deals an average of +75% damage (min. 1, max. +150%).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) This is independent from "[holy](/Holy "Holy")" damage, so undead that are rHoly (e.g. [profane servitors](/Profane_servitor "Profane servitor")) are not immune to holy wrath.

Undead players ([Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy"), [Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul"), [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire"), and [Death Form](/Death_Form "Death Form")) and [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") can wield weapons of holy wrath, but the brand is disabled for them. Using the brand will offend [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul"), but the other [evil](/Evil "Evil") gods won't mind.

## Contents

- [1 Sources](#Sources)
- [2 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Sources

Holy wrath can be found on any melee weapon except [demon blades](/Demon_blade "Demon blade"), [demon tridents](/Demon_trident "Demon trident"), and [demon whips](/Demon_whip "Demon whip") (which become their blessed counterparts instead). It can not be obtained through a [scroll of brand weapon](/Scroll_of_brand_weapon "Scroll of brand weapon"). It can also be found by:

- [The Shining One](/The_Shining_One "The Shining One"), at 6\* piety, can bless any weapon, including [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons"). This can be done once per game.
- Any [eudemon blades](/Eudemon_blade "Eudemon blade"), [trishulas](/Trishula "Trishula"), and [sacred scourges](/Sacred_scourge "Sacred scourge") you find will always have holy wrath (and cannot be rebranded without divine blessing). These are often found on [angels](/Angel "Angel"), [daevas](/Daeva "Daeva"), and [Mennas](/Mennas "Mennas").

## Tips & Tricks

- While holy wrath is weak in most early-game branches (such as [the Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair")), it excels in the [extended game](/Extended_game "Extended game"), when most branches are filled with powerful demons and undead. [The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt"), [the Tomb](/The_Tomb "The Tomb"), [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium") and the [Hells](/Hell "Hell") are especially good places to have a weapon of holy wrath.
- Holy wrath doesn't do anything against "[evil](/Evil "Evil")" creatures aren't actually undead or demonic, such as [necromancers](/Necromancer_\(monster\) "Necromancer (monster)") or [hell knights](/Hell_knight "Hell knight").

## History

- Prior to [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), undead and demonspawn couldn't wield weapons of holy wrath at all.
- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), weapons of holy wrath were immune to being [cursed](/Curse "Curse"), even from [Ashenzari](/Ashenzari "Ashenzari").
- Prior to [0.4](/0.4 "0.4"), holy wrath only dealt +50% average damage against undead (but had the same damage against demons).

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [attack.cc:1401](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31.0/crawl-ref/source/attack.cc#L1401) (0.31.0)

| Throwing weapons         | [Atropa](/Atropa "Atropa") • [Curare](/Curare "Curare") • [Datura](/Datura "Datura") • [Dispersal](/Dispersal_\(brand\) "Dispersal (brand)") • [Poisoned](/Poisoned "Poisoned") • [Silver](/Silver "Silver")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
html:
Holy wrath

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.
It has been blessed by The Shining One, dealing an additional three-quarters of any damage that pierces undead and demons' armour.

The holy wrath brand does the following:

  • Against undead and demons, deals an average of +75% damage (min. 1, max. +150%).[1] This is independent from "holy" damage, so undead that are rHoly (e.g. profane servitors) are not immune to holy wrath.

Undead players (Mummy, Ghoul, Vampire, and Death Form) and Demonspawn can wield weapons of holy wrath, but the brand is disabled for them. Using the brand will offend Yredelemnul, but the other evil gods won't mind.

Contents

  • 1 Sources
  • 2 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 History
  • 4 References

Sources

Holy wrath can be found on any melee weapon except demon blades, demon tridents, and demon whips (which become their blessed counterparts instead). It can not be obtained through a scroll of brand weapon. It can also be found by:

  • The Shining One, at 6* piety, can bless any weapon, including Ranged Weapons. This can be done once per game.
  • Any eudemon blades, trishulas, and sacred scourges you find will always have holy wrath (and cannot be rebranded without divine blessing). These are often found on angels, daevas, and Mennas.

Tips & Tricks

  • While holy wrath is weak in most early-game branches (such as the Lair), it excels in the extended game, when most branches are filled with powerful demons and undead. The Crypt, the Tomb, Pandemonium and the Hells are especially good places to have a weapon of holy wrath.
  • Holy wrath doesn't do anything against "evil" creatures aren't actually undead or demonic, such as necromancers or hell knights.

History

  • Prior to 0.32, undead and demonspawn couldn't wield weapons of holy wrath at all.
  • Prior to 0.24, weapons of holy wrath were immune to being cursed, even from Ashenzari.
  • Prior to 0.4, holy wrath only dealt +50% average damage against undead (but had the same damage against demons).

References

  1. ↑ attack.cc:1401 (0.31.0)

{{version032}}
{{flavour|It has been blessed by The Shining One, dealing an additional three-quarters of any damage that pierces undead and demons' armour.}}
The '''holy wrath''' [[brand]] does the following:
*Against [[undead]] and [[demon]]s, deals an average of +75% damage (min. 1, max. +150%).<ref>{{source ref|0.31.0|attack.cc|1401}}</ref> This is independent from "[[holy]]" damage, so undead that are rHoly (e.g. [[profane servitor]]s) are not immune to holy wrath.

Undead players ([[Mummy]], [[Ghoul]], [[Vampire]], and [[Death Form]]) and [[Demonspawn]] can wield weapons of holy wrath, but the brand is disabled for them. Using the brand will offend [[Yredelemnul]], but the other [[evil]] gods won't mind.

==Sources==
Holy wrath can be found on any melee weapon except [[demon blade]]s, [[demon trident]]s, and [[demon whip]]s (which become their blessed counterparts instead). It can not be obtained through a [[scroll of brand weapon]]. It can also be found by:
*[[The Shining One]], at 6* piety, can bless any weapon, including [[Ranged Weapons]]. This can be done once per game.
*Any [[eudemon blade]]s, [[trishula]]s, and [[sacred scourge]]s you find will always have holy wrath (and cannot be rebranded without divine blessing). These are often found on [[angel]]s, [[daeva]]s, and [[Mennas]].

==Tips & Tricks==
*While holy wrath is weak in most early-game branches (such as [[the Lair]]), it excels in the [[extended game]], when most branches are filled with powerful demons and undead. [[The Crypt]], [[the Tomb]], [[Pandemonium]] and the [[Hell]]s are especially good places to have a weapon of holy wrath.
*Holy wrath doesn't do anything against "[[evil]]" creatures aren't actually undead or demonic, such as [[necromancer (monster)|necromancers]] or [[hell knight]]s.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.32]], undead and demonspawn couldn't wield weapons of holy wrath at all.
*Prior to [[0.24]], weapons of holy wrath were immune to being [[curse]]d, even from [[Ashenzari]].
*Prior to [[0.4]], holy wrath only dealt +50% average damage against undead (but had the same damage against demons).
